replies.body: It's understandable that you'd want to keep pushing through towards victory, but it's important to keep in mind that Surrendering is put up for a *vote*. If majority rules (needs to be 4/5 usually I believe) then the vote passes. You still get your vote regardless, but the system needs to respect the wishes of the majority so that others aren't held hostage in a game they think they'd lose no matter what. Heck, sometimes people use surrender as a way to get out of a game they know they can't stay in due to IRL concerns and such.

The thing i've realised though, is that the ability to surrender makes some of these Project missions near impossible to complete. How am I able to destroy 3 inhibitors or farm up 12k gold if the enemy just surrenders when they're losing at 15 every single game?

Honestly I feel it just creates such a negative, defeatist attitude where after one death people want to surrender and just stop playing entirely. I just feel it's such a horrible mechanic in the game that hurts it more than it helps. If IRL stuff just happens to come up, then that's unfortunate, but it's more or less ruining the game for a lot of people.
